Primary_Text: a̭k͕̄t̜s̜ɛ karnassi̮d a̭ut̄ kā͕rnass̜t pa̭da̮ i ťš́a̭l̜m̄ɛ roŋ̄ᵍka̮
Analyzed: a̭k͕̄t̜s̜ɛ karnass-i̮d a̭ut̄ kā͕rnas-s̜t pa̭da̮ i ťš́a̭l̜m̄ɛ roŋ̄ᵍka̮
Gloss: nine raven-PRT one.GEN raven-LOC.SG buttocks.ACC.SG and eye.ACC.SG pick-PRS.3SG
Translation: Nine ravens pick at the buttocks and eye of another raven

Primary_Text: лi̮š́t mir i sogлas'je tagast tan˙n˙a čiллk kadɛmandɐs't˙
Analyzed: лi̮š́t mir i sogлas'je tag-ast tan˙n˙-a čiллk kadɛmand-ɐs't˙
Gloss: OPT peace and harmony make-MOM.PRS.3SG this-GEN.SG bright world-LOC.SG
Translation: May peace and harmony be in this bright world!

Primary_Text: jeᵍki̮ńì pi̮əďì kol't́ɛ oлmi̮i̯ pī̮t́ì roźa, a̭ńᴅ́ì a̭лɢ̄ańi
Analyzed: jeᵍki̮ńì pi̮əď-ì kol't́ɛ oлmi̮i̯ pī̮t́ì roźa, a̭ńᴅ́-ì a̭лɢ̄-ań-i.
Gloss: at.night come-PST.3SG golden man.NOM.SG bring-PST.3SG hourse.ACC.SG give-PST.3SG boy-DIM-DAT.SG
Translation: At night, a golden man came, brought a horse, and gave it to the boy.

Primary_Text: sii̯ poŕŕin i̮ən̄́ᴅ́t́š́as pe̮ᵍk‿kas i ȯaᴅti̮ški̮əᴅ́t́in
Analyzed: sii̯ poŕŕ-in i̮ən̄́ᴅ́t́š́as pe̮ᵍk=kas i ȯaᴅt-i̮ški̮əᴅ́t́-in
Translation: They ate all the meat and went to sleep.

Primary_Text: nan'tam šūr ki̮s's'e pɛdḓl'ev tɛk'ke jev sinɛ paih'kenɛs's'e
Analyzed: nan'tam šūr ki̮s's'e pɛdḓ-l'-ev tɛk'ke jev sin-ɛ paih'kenɛs's'-e
Gloss: such big guest.NOM.PL come-FRQ-PST.3PL only NEG.3PL 3PL-GEN place-DAT.SG
Translation: Such great guests used to come, but not to their place
She started to send the old man to the barn [often]
We'll take you on a boat

Primary_Text: kie muna̮ vìl'l'ɛ sā͕ᵍka, tȧs's'e mun ma̭nam ki̮i̯ji̮
Analyzed: kie mun-a̮ vìl'l'ɛ sā͕ᵍk-a, tȧs's'e mun ma̭n-am ki̮i̯j-i̮
Gloss: who.NOM.SG 1SG-GEN brother.ACC.SG find-PRS.3SG this.DAT.SG 1SG.NOM go-PRS.1SG housband-DAT.SG
Translation: Whoever gets my brother, I'll marry him

Primary_Text: tɛssɛl' kɛs l'anči jaллаmain˙ lin˙ ki̮kt˙ v'il'j
Analyzed: tɛssɛl' kɛs l'anči jaлла-main˙ lin˙ ki̮kt˙ v'il'j
Gloss: long.time.ago when INDEF live-PTCP.PST be.PST.3PL two brother.GEN.SG
Translation: Once upon a time, there lived two brothers

Primary_Text: mȯn tȧ̀mme ju vī̮r̜ᵈt̜ėm li̮š tȯna̮s̜̄t tȧ̀ᴅ̜t̜ɛ mīli̮st lėɔ̄ťš́ė
Analyzed: mȯn tȧ̀-mme ju vī̮r̜ᵈt̜-ėm li̮š tȯn-a̮s̜̄t tȧ̀ᴅ̜t̜ɛ mīli̮st lė-ɔ̄ťš́ė
Gloss: 1SG.NOM this-ACC.SG already wait-PST.1SG only 2SG-LOC this.NOM.SG favour.NOM.SG be-COND.3SG
Translation: I was looking forward to you doing me this favour.

Primary_Text: mon lėɔ̄ťš́ėᵐ tsārr je ā͕ɔ̄kam tsaritsa
Analyzed: mon lė-ɔ̄ťš́ė-ᵐ tsārr je ā͕ɔ̄k-am tsaritsa
Translation: If only I were tsar and my wife gueen

Primary_Text: aлti̮n˙im' muni̮ ja pi̮dḓi͔ ji̮l'l'ih'či son jamadžim'
Analyzed: aлt-i̮n˙-im' mun-i̮ ja pi̮dḓ-i͔ ji̮l'-l'i-h'či son jama-dž-im'
Translation: My reindeer brought me home, if it wasn't for her I would have died.

Primary_Text: mij vɛлčim varra l'ič m'ingᴇm asta
Analyzed: mij vɛл-č-im varr-a l'i-č m'in-gɛm asta
Translation: We would go to the woods if we had the time
What kind of people could it have been that came?

Primary_Text: koxt t'es't˙ pi̮n'n'ɐv koz uitɛv sint k'assa
Analyzed: koxt t'es't˙ pi̮n'n'-ɐv koz uit-ɛv sin-t k'ass-a
Gloss: how here herd-PRS.3PL where move 3PL-ACC summer.DAT.SG
Translation: How one herds [reindeer] here, where one moves them to for the summer
What can you find [there] when there is no one

Primary_Text: mȯn tȧ̀l̜ tȯn̜n̜e a̭nᴅ̀am uš tīᴅ̜t̜eᵈ
Analyzed: mȯn tȧ̀l̜ tȯn̜n̜-e a̭nᴅ̀-am uš tīᴅ̜t̜-eᵈ
Translation: I'll give you [a hit] so you know how to [behave properly]!

Primary_Text: kodťš́a̮i̯ jienna̭i̯ narodt, rāʙpaᵈ t'š́īŋles koʙa̮
Analyzed: kodťš́a̮-i̯ jienna̭i̯ narodt, rāBp-aᵈ t'š́īŋl-es koBa̮
Gloss: call-PST.3SG many people dig-INF deep-ATTR hole.ACC.SG
Translation: He called many people to dig a deep hole
There was a window in the barn
There is a lot of fish in this lake
There is a mouse in the barn
There is food and grain in the barn.

Primary_Text: sii̯ vi̮l̄'gḱin, vān̄́ᵈt́śav, vān̄́ᵈt́śav i pi̮əᴅ́t́in pa̭Ŕt́e
Analyzed: sii̯ vi̮l̄'gḱ-in, vān̄́ᵈt́ś-av, vān̄́ᵈt́ś-av i pi̮əᴅ́t́-in pa̭Ŕt́-e
Gloss: 3PL.NOM went.out-PST.3PL go-PRS.3PL go-PRS.3PL and come-PST.3PL house-DAT.SG
Translation: They went out and walked and walked and walked and came to the house
The young wife became thin without eating

Primary_Text: nu kaǯ́it˙ uštɛ majt oārak oлkstaśt ńaʒaman˙
Analyzed: nu kaǯ́-it˙ uštɛ majt oār-ak oлkst-aśt ńaʒa-man˙
Gloss: PTCL ask-PRS.IPS PTCL what stay-PRS.2SG beam-LOC.SG hold-CVB
Translation: [The bridegroom] is asked:Well, why are you standing with your hand on the beam?
They shoved a horn button down the throat of a sleeping young wife

Primary_Text: pi̮ə̑d̜ì sȯn̜n̜e aᵈz mī̮r̜j̀e ussa̮m ziì̭jɒ
Analyzed: pi̮ə̑d̜ì sȯn̜n̜-e aᵈz mī̮r̜j̀e uss-a̮m ziì̭j-ɒ
Translation: Adz came to him at the berry picking spot
He caught reindeer with a harness

Primary_Text: porᵈt̜k͕eȧnnᵃ lɛm pȯra̮m ta̭l̜̄ jĭes̄kᴬ ju͕ɔ̄t̜egȯadam
Analyzed: por-ᵈt̜-k͕eȧnnᵃ lɛm pȯr-a̮m ta̭l̜̄ jĭes̄kᴬ ju͕ɔ̄t̜e-gȯad-am
Gloss: eat-CAUS-PTCP.NEG be.PRS-1SG eat-PRS.1SG PTCL then tell-INCH-PRS.1SG
Translation: I'm humgry, I'll eat, and then tell you [the story]

Primary_Text: kie pȯaᴅta kà͕л̀лazań̄ᵈťš́e ᵛi̮ə̑ᴅ̜t̜em gi̮ə̑iᵍk son pā͕ɔ̄kᴬ màī̭na̮zi̮ ju͕ɔ̄t̜eᵈ
Analyzed: kie pȯaᴅt-a kà͕л̀лaz-ań̄ᵈťš́-e ᵛi̮ə̑ᴅ̜t̜-em gi̮ə̑iᵍk son pā͕ɔ̄k-ᴬ màī̭na̮z-i̮ ju͕ɔ̄t̜-eᵈ
Gloss: who.NOM.SG come-PRS.1SG old.man-DIM-DAT.SG sleep-PTCP for 3SG.NOM order-PRS.3SG story-ACC.SG tell-INF
Translation: Whoever comes to the old man to sleep, he orders [him] to tell a story.
I went to call the weepers, my wife died
There is a house by the river.
There are villages by the rivers.

Primary_Text: a̭k̄t kā͕rnas a̭k͕̄t̜s̜ɛ kā͕rnass̜t ťš́a̭l̜m̄ɛ je pa̭da̮ roŋ̄ᵍka̮
Analyzed: a̭k̄t kā͕rnas a̭k͕̄t̜s̜ɛ kā͕rnas-s̜t ťš́a̭l̜m̄ɛ je pa̭da̮ roŋ̄ᵍk-a̮
Gloss: one raven nine raven-LOC.SG eye.ACC.SG and buttocks.ACC.SG pick-PRS.3SG
Translation: One raven picks at the buttocks and eyes of nine ravens
We cannot fish without a river
What will I do without my son?

Primary_Text: jenntɛ mu̙nn vɛllka tanne paʀst pāgi̮
Analyzed: jenntɛ mu̙nn vɛllk-a tann-e paʀ-st pāgi̮
Translation: Tommorow I will go away from this house
The old woman is in the house
They started stabbing [them] with their spears
Father went into the forest with dogs
[He can't remember] where his home village is
His girl is nowhere [to be found]
I set up (PRS) :to set up :I set up (PST)
